explanation: To determine whether UtMessage is (directly or indirectly) recursive we must follow outgoing calls from UtMessage and then follow any calls those functions make looking for a path back to UtMessage. UT_BSP_DoText is directly invoked by UtMessage, so its body must be analyzed. Each symbol listed is a callee of UT_BSP_DoText (per the static call graph) and therefore must be inspected because any of them — or functions they call transitively — could contain a call back to UtMessage, producing indirect recursion. (Standard library/varargs helpers used inside UtMessage, e.g. vsnprintf/va_start/va_end, do not need to be included for this MISRA recursion check because they will not call user-level functions.)
